page.title: 10 THE DELL IN 1917
page.content: This is a comparative account of the area by a lady born in the Dell in 1917. The word{"Dell"}means a little valley shaded by trees. That is what the dell was in 1917. Towards the shore end there were big Victorian houses stading in a garden on either side. Two of these still remain, converted into flats. Later the lane was built up with houses all the way up to{New Chester Rd. }The{New Ferry} {pier}was just by our house where there is now an open grassed space to the right of a little beach. In the early twenties a ship crashed into the pier in the fog and it was destroyed. I was sad to see the fly-over for the by-pass over-shadowing the dell, but pleased to see that our house, which had been derelict for some time had been replaced by new houses and green areas had replaced the old pier.
